STATIC_heading.text: ABBREVIATIONS

STATIC_table.text:
AbantibodyHCLhairy cell leukemia—abnormal lymphocytes accumulate in bone marrow, leading to anemia, thrombocytopenia, neutropenia, and infection
ABMTautologous bone marrow transplantation—patient serves as his or her own donor for stem cellsHcthematocrit
ABOfour main blood types—A, B, AB, and OHgb, HGBhemoglobin
ALLacute lymphoid leukemiaH and Hhemoglobin and hematocrit
AMLacute myeloid leukemiaHLAhuman leukocyte antigen
ANCabsolute neutrophil count—total WBC times a measure of the number of bands and segs present in the blood; an ANC less than 1500 cells/uL is neutropeniaIgA, IgD, IgE, IgG, IgMimmunoglobulins
ASCTautologous stem cell transplantationINRinternational normalized ratio--ratio of a patient’s prothrombin time compared to a standard prothrombin time, used to monitor anticoagulation (warfarin) therapy.
bandsimmature white blood cells (granulocytes)ITPidiopathic thrombocytopenic purpura
basobasophilslymphslymphocytes
BMTbone marrow transplantationMCHmean corpuscular hemoglobin—average amount of hemoglobin per cell
CBCcomplete blood countMCHCmean corpuscular hemoglobin concentration—average concentration of hemoglobin in a single red cell; when MCHC is low, the cell is hypochromic
CLLchronic lymphoid leukemiaMCVmean corpuscular volume—average volume or size of a single red blood cell; when MCV is high, the cells are macrocytic, and when low, the cells are microcytic
CMLchronic myeloid leukemiaμLmicroliter—one millionth of a liter; 1 liter = 1.057 quarts
DICdisseminated intravascular coagulation— bleeding disorder marked by reduction in blood clotting factorsMDSmyelodysplastic syndrome—preleukemic condition (anemia, cytopenias, and possible transformation to AML)
diffdifferential count (white blood cells)mm3cubic millimeter—one millionth of a liter; 1 liter = 1.057 quarts
EBVEpstein-Barr virus; cause of mononucleosismonomonocyte
eoseosinophilspolys, PMNs, PMNLspolymorphonuclear leukocytes; neutrophils, eosinophils, basophils
EPOerythropoietinPT, pro timeprothrombin time
ESRerythrocyte sedimentation ratePTTpartial thromboplastin time
FeironRBCred blood cell; red blood cell count
G-CSFgranulocyte colony-stimulating factor— promotes neutrophil productionsed rateerythrocyte sedimentation rate
GM-CSFgranulocyte-macrophage colonystimulating factor—promotes myeloid progenitor cells with differentiation to granulocytessegssegmented, mature white blood cells (neutrophils)
g/dLgram per deciliter (1 deciliter = one tenth of a liter or just over 3 ounces.SMACSequential Multiple Analyzer Computer—an automated chemistry system that determines substances in serum
GVHDgraft-versus-host disease—immune reaction of donor’s cells to recipient’s tissueWBCwhite blood cell; white blood cell count
  WNLwithin normal limits
